title.narrative: Research on Narratives and Civic Space

description.narrative:
JOINT # Liga das ONGs em Moçambique is a network of civil society organizations founded in 2007 whose mission is #to link and strengthen civil society institutions with a view to improving collective action for the common good and dialogue with the Stateand the Private Sector #. Its objective is #to contribute to the strengthening of an enabling environment for the action of civil society in Mozambique, increasing its capacity to intervene in a coordinated and concerted manner in the country development#.
Based on country context, Oxfam in Mozambique and partners developed in 2018 a Civic Space Action Plan that defined as a final goal: Mozambican CSOs including WROs are strong and solid and enjoy a sound and enabling environment to freely and effectively participate in country development processes by 2020. One of the outcomes of the project is: Strengthened CSOs, including WROs, legitimacy to ensure that they represent Civil Society interests and are accountable by 2020. In order to contribute for this end, we are proposing to run a research on perceptions and narratives around civil society, this research with help us to build a new positive narratives around civilsociety and create and disseminate stories about the positive contribution of civil society in Mozambique in a time where there is huge attack against those actors. A new narrative will be a way to open space for debate, support activism and create space for a different conversation.
Joint will be leading this research. The main objective of this collaboration is to do a research on the narratives and perceptions about civil society in Mozambique as well as its underlying causes, with the objective of Increase the legitimacy and the power of Mozambican civil society for a better enabling environment and open civic space.

participating-org.narrative: Founded in 2008, JOINT- is Mozambican forum of NGOs. It comprises 20 national civil society organizations and 10 foreign NGOs. Themain objective of Joint is to promote and facilitate dissemination of practices and exchange of experience among civil society organizations in Mozambique. The focus of Joint extends to promoting linkages and dialogue among civil society organizations and local government including international NGOs to influence good governance in Mozambique and in the region

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
